page.title: 19PROVAN HALL
page.content:
Formerly known as Hall Mailing, {Provan Hall}is situated in the recently developed Auchinlea Park. The present house, thought to date from the{1470's,}provided a country seat for successive Prebendies of Glasgow Cathedral. (A Prebend or Canon was the official of the Cathedral. Provan is a corruption of Prebend.)
The House, now in the care of the {National Trust,}has been described as perhaps one of the most perfect examples remaining in Scotland of the simple Monkish houses of the pre-Reformation times.
Unfortunately, Provan Hall is rarely opened to the public and the Parks Department use the building to store their grass mowers and other gardening equipment.
